sentences.text: March 6, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Shareowners:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to invite you to the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on Thursday, April 20, 2017, at our Easton Business Service Center in Columbus, Ohio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will consider the matters described in the following Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement and review highlights of the past year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope you will attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year proved to be an extraordinary time for Huntington in many ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We celebrated 150 years of service to customers and communities, and completed the largest acquisition in our history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With that acquisition, we welcomed many new and talented colleagues across the markets where we both operated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our team is stronger than ever and committed to delivering the same exceptional customer service that has distinguished Huntington in the past.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The hard work and dedication of our colleagues allowed us to enter 2017 a stronge Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is still more work to be done with the integration, and we will continue to invest in colleagues and our focus on being a Welcome brand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We added to the composition of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of the Board regularly reviews the composition of the Board to ensure its members represent the strongest knowledge and experience aligned with the Companys business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notably, the Board appointed Chris Inglis, a renowned cyber- security expert and leader, to serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We further welcome the substantial experience and perspectives that four additional new Board members  former directors of FirstMerit Corporation  have brought to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These new directors are Lizabeth Ardisana, Owner and Founder of a technical and communication services firm, ASG Renaissance; Robert S. Cubbin, retired President and Chief Executive Officer of Meadowbrook Insurance Group; Gina D. France, President and Chief Executive Officer of France Strategic Partners LLC, a strategy and transactional advisory firm; and J. Michael Hochschwender, President and Chief Executive Officer of The Smithers Group, a private group of companies that provide technology-based services to a global clientele in a broad range of industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are delighted to welcome our new members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board extends enormous gratitude to John B. (Jay) Gerlach, Jr who will be stepping down from the Board after 18 years of extraordinary service as a Director, as well as the long-term chair of our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recognizes the importance of risk management and has set a strong tone at the top.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board monitors the Companys adherence to the Boards established aggregate moderate-to-low risk appetite chiefly through its committee structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board continually evaluates our corporate governance as best practices evolve and appreciates the perspectives of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Statement provides additional detail on our corporate governance, including on the composition of our Board of Directors, the role of the Board committees, and the Boards role in risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are focused on growing the organization and improving performance, enhancing our customer and colleagues experience and proactively managing risk, all with a view of long-term consistent performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the annual meeting, we encourage you to read the Proxy Statement carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote via internet, telephone or mail to ensure that your shares are represented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your support of Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Best wishes,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stephen D. Steinour Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information for Shareholders Who Plan to Attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Business Service Center, 7 Easton Oval, is located on the east side of Columbus near I-270 and Easton Way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There will be ample parking available as well as assistance (shuttle service and wheel chairs) in transportation from the parking lot to the building entrance.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thursday, April 20, 2017, at 2:00 p.m. local time Huntingtons Easton Business Service Center, 7 Easton Oval, Columbus, Ohio 43219 The purposes of the annual meeting are to consider and vote on the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the election of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an advisory resolution to approve, on a non-binding basis, the compensation of executives as disclosed in the accompanying proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an advisory, non-binding recommendation on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other business that properly comes before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by executing and returning your proxy card in the accompanying envelope, or by authorizing your proxy electronically over the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to the proxy card enclosed for nformation on authorizing your proxy electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting, you may vote in person if you are a holder of record or you obtain a legal proxy from your broker, bank or other holder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a broker, it is important that you provide instructions to your broker so that your vote is counted on all matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers do not have discretionary authority to vote on the election of directors or matters related to the compensation of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard A. Cheap General Counsel & Secretary March 6, 2017

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Matters:        Our Boards Recommendation: Proposal 1 Election of Directors   FOR ALL Proposal 2   Ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017   FOR Proposal 3   Advisory resolution to approve, on a non-binding basis, the compensation of executives as disclosed in the accompanying proxy statement   FOR Proposal 4   Advisory, non-binding recommendation on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EVERY YEAR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation philosophy and programs for executives are balanced and risk appropriate, demonstrate long-term alignment with long-term sustained performance and shareholder interests, and provide a competitive and effective program to attract, motivate and retain the best talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is supported by the following leading market practices incorporated into our program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require that executives own a significant amount of company stock and hold a significant portion of the net shares earned until retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any above target payments from our annual incentive program are paid in restricted stock units that vest over 3 years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of our annual long-term incentive awards for named executives only vest to the extent performance criteria have been achieved or exceeded
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a broad, diverse group of incentive metrics in both our annual and long-term incentive programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a Recoupment / Clawback Policy applicable to all incentive compensation for all employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Agreements are double-trigger
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors has established strong governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors represents a well-rounded variety of skills, knowledge, experience and perspectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are elected annually with a majority voting standard
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an independent and engaged Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of our directors are independent, and key committees are comprised of independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing this proxy statement in connection with the solicitation by the board of directors of Huntington Bancshares Incorporated, a Maryland corporation (we, us, our, the company or Huntington), of proxies to be voted at our 2017 annual meeting of shareholders to be held on April 20, 2017, and at any adjournment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are sending or making this proxy statement available to our shareholders on or about March 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Information about the Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of common stock at the close of business on February 15, 2017, are entitled to vote at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of that date, there were 1,090,179,467 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of our Series A Preferred Stock, Series B Preferred Stock, Series C Preferred Stock and Series D Preferred Stock are not entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each holder of common stock is entitled to cast one vote on each matter submitted at the annual meeting for each share of stock held of record at the close of business on February 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares represented by a properly submitted proxy will be voted as directed provided we receive the proxy prior to or at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A properly executed proxy without specific voting instructions will be voted FOR Proposal 1  Election of Directors, FOR Proposal 2  Ratification of the Appointment of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm, FOR Proposal 3  Advisory Approval of Executive Compensation, and with respect to Proposal 4  Advisory Recommendation on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation  for a frequency of EVERY year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A properly submitted proxy will also confer discretionary authority to vote on any other matter which may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by executing and returning your proxy card in the envelope provided, or by voting electronically over the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to the proxy card for information on voting electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting, you may vote in person and the proxy will not be used.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not currently aware of any matters that may properly be presented other than those described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any matters not described in the proxy statement are properly presented at the meeting, the proxies will use their own judgment to determine how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the meeting is adjourned, the proxies can vote your common stock at the adjournment as well, unless you have revoked your proxy instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revoking Your Proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your common stock is held in street name, you must follow the instructions of your broker, bank or other nominee to revoke your voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a holder of record and wish to revoke your proxy instructions, you must advise our secretary in writing before the proxies vote your common stock at the meeting, deliver later dated proxy instructions, or attend the meeting and vote your shares in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expenses of Solicitation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay the expenses of this proxy solicitation, including the reasonable charges and expenses of brokerage firms and others for forwarding solicitation material to their customers who are beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to soliciting proxies by mail and via the Internet, our employees may also solicit proxies by telephone and in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have retained Morrow Sodali LLC, 470 West Ave., Stamford, CT 06902, to assist in the solicitation of proxies for a fee of $10,000 plus reimbursement of expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum is required to conduct business at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders entitled to cast a majority of all the votes entitled to be cast at the annual meeting, present in person or by proxy, will constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: a nominee for election to the board of directors at a meeting of shareholders at which a quorum is present will be elected only if the number of votes cast for such nominees election exceeds the total number of votes cast against or affirmatively withheld as to such nominees election; provided, however, that if, on either the date of the companys proxy statement for the meeting or on the date of the meeting, the number of nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected, the directors shall be elected by a plurality of all the votes cast at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 2 and 3: each requires the affirmative vote of a majority of all votes cast on the matter by the holders of common stock at a meeting at which a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4: the option of one year, two years or three years that receives a majority of all the votes cast at a meeting at which a quorum is present will be the frequency of the advisory vote recommended by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that no option receives a majority of the votes cast, we will consider the option that receives the most votes to be the option selected by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the laws of Maryland, our state of incorporation, abstentions and broker non-votes are counted for purposes of determining the presence or absence of a quorum, but are not counted as votes cast at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes occur when brokers who hold their customers shares in street name submit proxies for such shares on some matters, but not others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, this would occur when brokers have not received any instructions from their customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these cases, the brokers, as the holders of record, are permitted to vote on routine matters, which typically include the ratification of the independent registered public accounting firm, but not on non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers are no longer permitted to vote on the election of directors or on matters related to executive compensation without instructions from their customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on the election of any director or the approval of the other matters described above since they are not counted as votes cast at the meeting, but votes affirmatively withheld from the election of any nominee will have the effect of a vote against that nominees election as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors recommends that you vote FOR all of the director nominees, FOR proposals 2 and 3, and FOR the proposal to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines, Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors has a corporate governance program which includes Corporate Governance Guidelines and a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applies to all of our employees and, where applicable, to our directors, and to employees and directors of our affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our employees serving as chief executive officer, chief financial officer, corporate controller, and principal accounting officer are also bound by a Financial Code of Ethics for Chief Executive Officer and Senior Financial Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and the Financial Code of Ethics for Chief Executive Officer and Senior Financial Officers are posted on the Investor Relations pages of Huntingtons website at www.huntington.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings and Committee Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors held a total of 15 regular and special meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that regular attendance at meetings is of utmost importance, and we encourage our directors to attend the annual shareholders meetings and at east 75% of all regularly scheduled board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, each director attended greater than 75% of the meetings of the full board of directors and the committees on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors then serving attended the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors has eight standing committees of the board: Audit, Community Development, Compensation, Executive, Huntington Investment Company Oversight, Nominating and Corporate Governance, Risk Oversight, and Technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time the board of directors may appoint ad hoc committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Integration Oversight Committee was established in February 2016 as an ad hoc committee to assist the board in the oversight of the integration of people, systems, and processes of FirstMerit Corporation with Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All board members have access to all committee reports and materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all board members are welcome to attend any meetings of the standing committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each standing committee has a separate written charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current copies of the committee charters are posted on the Investor Relations pages of our website at www.huntington.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the boards standing committees, including the committee members and a brief review of each committees responsibilities, is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members: Richard W. Neu (Chair) Ann B. Crane Gina D. France Eddie R. Munson   Meetings Held in 2016: 10   (includes 5 held jointly with the Risk Oversight Committee)     The Audit Committee oversees the integrity of the consolidated financial statements, including policies, procedures, and practices regarding the preparation of financial statements, the financial reporting process, disclosures, and internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also provides assistance to the board in overseeing the internal audit division and the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications, performance and independence; compliance with our Financial Code of Ethics for the chief executive officer and senior financial officers; and compliance with corporate securities trading policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Audit Committee has the duties and responsibilities set forth above and as set forth in its charter, our management is responsible for the internal controls and the financial reporting process, and the independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for performing an independent audit of our financial statements and our internal controls over financial reporting in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards and issuing a report thereon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically meets in joint session with the Risk Oversight Committee to cover matters relevant to both, such as the capital plan and the construct and appropriateness of the allowance for credit losses, which is reviewed quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has determined that each of Richard W. Neu, chairman of the Audit Committee, Gina D. France and Eddie R. Munson qualifies as an audit committee financial expert as the term is defined in the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This designation does not impose any duties, obligations or liabilities on them that are greater than the duties, obligations and liabilities imposed on the other members of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Audit Committee qualifies as an independent director as the term is defined in the Nasdaq Stock Market Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Report of the Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary responsibility of the Audit Committee is to oversee the integrity of Huntingtons consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its duties, the Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed the audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 with Huntington management and with Huntingtons independent registered public accounting firm, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This discussion included the selection, application and disclosure of critical accounting policies, as well as the firms views on fraud risks and how it demonstrates its independence and skepticism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also reviewed with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP its judgment as to the quality, not just the acceptability, of Huntingtons accounting principles and such other matters required to be discussed under auditing standards generally accepted in the United States, including the Public Company Accounting Oversight Boards Auditing Standard No. 16, Communication with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has reviewed the written disclosures and the letter from PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP required by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in Rule 3526 regarding PricewaterhouseCoopers LLPs communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP its independence from Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussion, and a review of the services provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP during 2016, the Audit Committee believes that the services provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP in 2016 are compatible with, and do not impair, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLPs independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these reviews and discussions, the Audit Committee recommended to the board of directors that the audited consolidated financial statements be included in Huntingtons Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 which was filed with the SEC on February 22, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitted by the Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard W. Neu, Chair Ann B. Crane Gina D. France Eddie R. Munson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee fulfills the duties and responsibilities of the board as it relates to executive and director compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its duties, the committee reviews and approves Huntingtons goals and objectives with respect to the compensation of the chief executive officer and other executive management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also evaluates the performance of the chief executive officer and other executive management in light of such goals and objectives, and sets their compensation levels based on such evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee advises the board of directors with respect to compensation for service by non-employee directors on the board of directors and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also makes recommendations to the board of directors with respect to Huntingtons incentive compensation plans and equity-based plans, oversees the activities of the individuals and committees responsible for administering these plans, and discharges any responsibility imposed on the Compensation Committee by any of these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee assists the board of directors in fulfillment of the duties and responsibilities delegated to the board under our retirement plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedures for Determining Executive and Director Compensation; Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the resources and authority appropriate to discharge its duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes authority to select, retain, terminate and approve fees and other retention terms of advisors, including legal counsel and other advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee engaged Pearl Meyer & Partners, LLC, an independent consulting firm, to provide advisory services related to executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individual consultant managing the relationship with Huntington (the compensation consultant) reports directly to the Compensation Committee, and is evaluated by the Compensation Committee on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant is available as needed for expert guidance and support, provides updates on emerging trends and best practices, and frequently attends meetings of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Services provided by the compensation consultant during 2016 included review of our selected peer group, benchmarking compensation and performance, and establishing total compensation guidelines, including targets for short and long-term incentive plans, and modeling payouts under various performance scenarios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016 the compensation consultant did not provide any services other than advice and recommendations related to executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has received representations from the compensation consultant with respect to independence, including with respect to: the fees received by the consulting firm from Huntington as a percentage of total revenue of the consulting firm; the policies or procedures maintained by the consulting firm designed to prevent a conflict of interest; any business or personal relationship between the compensation consultant and any Compensation Committee member; any business or personal relationship between the compensation consultant and executive officers of Huntington; and any Huntington stock owned by the compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on review of these representations and the services provided by the compensation consultant, the Compensation Committee has determined that the compensation consultant is independent and that the consultants work has not created any conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Compensation Committee makes independent determinations on all matters related to compensation of executive officers, certain members of management are requested to attend committee meetings and provide input to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Input may be sought from the chief executive officer, Human Resources, Finance, and Risk Management colleagues and others as needed to ensure the Compensation Committee has the information and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: perspective it needs to carry out its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Compensation Committee will seek input from the chief executive officer on matters relating to strategic objectives, company performance goals and input on his assessment of the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also receives regular updates from the chief risk officer and chief financial officer throughout the year as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Human Resources work with the Chair of the Compensation Committee to ensure he has the background, information and data needed to facilitate meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee meets with representatives of the Audit Committee as appropriate in making determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee chair attends the meetings at which the Compensation Committee certifies company performance against the established incentive plan performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes risk into account when determining compensation and has developed an executive compensation philosophy that balances risk and reward with a mix of base pay, short-term incentives and long- term incentives, with greater emphasis on long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees role in the oversight of incentive compensation risk is discussed under The Boards Role in Risk Oversight, below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate all or a portion of its duties and responsibilities to a subcommittee of the Compensation Committee, or in accordance with the terms of a particular compensation plan, to a management committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee delegates some responsibilities to management to assist in development of design considerations, with permission to work with the Committees compensation consultant to develop proposals for the Committees consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may not, however, delegate the determination of compensation for executive officers to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, the Compensation Committee may obtain the approval of the board of directors with respect to certain executive and director compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no compensation committee interlocks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, no member of the Compensation Committee has served as one of our officers or employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Report of the Compensation Committee (1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussion, the Compensation Committee recommended to the board of directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in Huntingtons proxy statement for its 2017 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitted by the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John B. Gerlach, Jr., Chair Peter J. Kight Kathleen H. Ransier
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  Mr. Cubbin was appointed to serve on the Compensation Committee after the Compensation Committee issued this report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees primary responsibilities are to annually: review the composition of the board of directors to assure that the appropriate knowledge, skills, and experience are represented, in the Committees judgment, and to assure that the composition of the board of directors complies with applicable laws and regulations; review the qualifications of persons recommended for board of directors membership, including persons recommended by shareholders; discuss with the board of directors standards to be applied in making determinations as to the independence of directors; and review the effectiveness of the board of directors, including but not limited to, considering the size and desired skills of the board of directors and the performance of individual directors as well as collective performance of the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and approves related party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally the Committee oversees the companys efforts to effectively communicate with shareholders, including shareholder outreach, matters relating to the companys proxy filing, and other governance issues and efforts throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other responsibilities of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee include reviewing and making appropriate changes to the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Huntingtons directors, officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Community Development Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Community Development Committee is to promote Huntingtons mission of local involvement and leadership in the communities where Huntington is located and where its employees work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will consider matters relating to community development and involvement, philanthropy, government affairs, fair and responsible lending and inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members: David L. Porteous (Chair) Ann B. Crane Steven G. Elliott Michael J. Endres Jonathan A. Levy Richard W. Neu Stephen D. Steniour
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committees purpose is to provide an efficient means of considering matters that arise between regularly scheduled meetings of the full board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matters that might be considered by the Executive Committee are such that either require prompt attention or are deemed appropriate by the Executive Committee to consider on behalf of the full board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of this Committee may be called by the chief executive officer (who is a member of the Committee) or the Committee chairperson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee shall have and may exercise all of the powers and authority of the board of directors as may be permitted by law, and the charter and bylaws of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All actions of and powers conferred by the Executive Committee are deemed to be done and conferred under the authority of the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members: Steven G. Elliott (Chair) Lizabeth Ardisana Jonathan A. Levy David L. Porteous
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight Committee assists the board of directors in overseeing management of material risks, and the approval and monitoring of the companys capital position and plan supporting our overall aggregate moderate-to-low risk profile; the risk governance structure; compliance with applicable laws and regulations; and determining adherence to the boards stated risk appetite.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has oversight responsibility with respect to the full range of inherent risks: market, credit, liquidity, legal, compliance/regulatory, operational, strategic and reputational.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Committee also oversees our capital management and planning process, and ensures that the amount and quality of capital are adequate in relation to expected and unexpected risks and that our capital levels exceed well-capitalized requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 20
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (includes 5 held jointly with the Audit Committee)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight Committee periodically meets in joint session with the Audit Committee to cover matters relevant to both, such as the capital plan and the construct and appropriateness of the allowance for credit losses, which is reviewed quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional detail about the role and responsibilities of this Committee is set forth under The Boards Role in Risk Oversight below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Technology Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members: Peter J. Kight (Chair) Lizabeth Ardisana Michael J. Endres Chris Inglis   Meetings Held in 2016: 4     The purpose of the Technology Committee is to assist the board of directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with respect to all technology, cyber security and third party risk management strategies and plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is charged with evaluating Huntingtons capability to properly perform all technology functions necessary for its business plan, including projected growth, technology capacity, planning, operational execution, product development, new technologies and management capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee provides oversight of the technology segment investments and plans to drive efficiency as well as to meet defined standards for risk, security, and redundancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee oversees the allocation of technology costs and ensures that they are understood by the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee monitors and evaluates innovation and technology trends that may affect the companys strategic plans, including monitoring of overall industry trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee reviews and provides oversight of the companys continuity and disaster recovery planning and preparedness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington Investment Company Oversight Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors established the Huntington Investment Company (HIC) Oversight Committee in 2016 to assist the board of directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with respect to retail and institutional broker-dealer and investment advisory strategies and plans developed by the HIC Board and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Committee will provide oversight related to the overall risk management process for HIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings Held in 2016: 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees duties and responsibilities include to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide oversight regarding HICs business strategy, including projected revenue growth, business planning, market strategies, product and service offerings, technology and computer systems, and operational execution;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure that an effective process is in place to manage risks through policies, procedures, and practices in a manner consistent with HICs strategic goals, organizational objectives, risk appetite and regulatory requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide oversight regarding the development of strategies to address emerging industry trends, new rules, and regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluate and assess actions taken by HIC in response to auditors, consultants and regulatory authorities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluate and assess service quality regarding customer complaints or comments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Integration Oversight Committee (ad hoc)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Integration Oversight Committee is an ad hoc committee established to assist he Board in the oversight of the integration of people, systems and processes of FirstMerit Corporation with Huntington through enhanced review and effective challenge of integration plans and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees duties and responsibilities with respect to the FirstMerit acquisition include review of the:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: overall integration and conversion project plan, the timeline and adjustments thereto;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: progress of Huntington in obtaining any necessary regulatory approvals relative t the acquisition through periodic updates; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: progress of Huntington in integrating systems and personnel in a timely and professional manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the Risk Oversight Committee, the Committee shall receive and review risks, including operational, market, liquidity and credit, posed by the integration and the effective mitigation of those risks to ensure that the residual risk is within Huntingtons risk appetite.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall receive and review reports that assess Huntingtons financial performance against its goals, including capturing synergies and opportunities from its acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee shall oversee Huntingtons conformance to regulatory and contractual commitments made in connection with the acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to send communications to the board of directors may do so by following the procedure set forth on the Investor Relations pages of Huntingtons website at www.huntington.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination and Board Evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors is committed to maintaining a well-rounded and effective board aligned with the companys business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least annually the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews the composition of the board to assure that the appropriate knowledge, skills and experience are represented, in the Committees judgment, and in order to comply with applicable laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full board of directors performs a self-evaluation each year, overseen by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director, as chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, solicits comments and recommendations from the directors through a series of questions which provide a frame-work for discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the specific questions may vary from year-to-year, the topics generally include the substance and efficiency of board and committee meetings and materials, utilization of skills and committee appointments, skills and experience needed for the board, and board engagement and interaction, and have an emphasis on the boards responsibility for oversight of risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lead director provides a report to the board in executive session summarizing the feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee of the board also performs an annual self-evaluation and reports the findings to the full board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Perspectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors embody a well-rounded variety of skills, knowledge, and experience, as demonstrated in the chart below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board also benefits from directors having a range of tenures as this provides continuity as well as fresh perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience / Background    Number of Directors  Audit  Internal or External Experience      6  Consumer products experience      7  Cybersecurity      1  Enhances the diversity of the Board (e.g. gender, race, ethnicity and culture)      5  Experience in leading alignment of compensation with organizational strategy and performance      8  Expertise in financial institution and regulatory matters      9  Financial expertise      6  Governmental experience; non-profit or non-financial regulatory expertise      5  Leadership in enterprise risk management function      5  Legal experience      3  Merger, acquisition and/or joint venture expertise      15  Private equity management experience      6  Senior executive experience (e.g. CEO, COO, CFO) at a publicly traded company      6  Strategic technology leadership at a large, complex, organization      6     Tenure         05 years      7  610 years      5  1115 years      3  1618 years      1     Age         5660      7  6165      5  6670      4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board believes that one of its most important responsibilities is identifying, evaluating and selecting candidates for the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board members are encouraged to identify prospective directors and recommend them to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews the qualifications of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: potential director candidates and makes recommendations to the full board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors considered by the Committee and the board in their review of potential candidates include whether the candidate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has exhibited behavior that indicates he or she is committed to the highest ethical standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has special skills, expertise and background that would complement the attributes of the existing directors, taking into consideration the diverse communities and geographies in which the company operates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has achieved prominence in his or her business, governmental or professional activities, and has built a reputation that demonstrates the ability to make the kind of important and sensitive judgments that the board is called upon to make;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: possesses a willingness to challenge management while working constructively as part of a team in an environment of trust; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will be able to devote sufficient time and energy to the performance of his or her duties as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board also believes that board membership should reflect the diversity of the markets in which we do business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will identify additional selection criteria for board membership, taking into consideration the companys business strategy, the business environment and current board omposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this time, there are no other specific additional criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations for Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may recommend director candidates for consideration by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee by sending a written notice to the Secretary at Huntington Bancshares Incorporated, Huntington Center, 41 South High Street, Columbus, Ohio 43287.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice should indicate the name, age, and address of the person recommended, the persons principal occupation or employment for the last five years, other public company boards on which the person serves, whether the person would qualify as independent as the term is defined under the Marketplace Rules of the Nasdaq Stock Market, and the class and number of shares of Huntington securities owned by the person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may require additional information to determine the qualifications of the person recommended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice should also state the name and address of, and the class and number of shares of our securities owned by, the person or persons making the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There have been no material changes to the shareholder recommendation process since we last disclosed this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee have reviewed and evaluated transactions and relationships with board members to determine the independence of each of the members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors does not believe that any of its non-employee members has relationships with us that would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out his or her responsibilities as director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the board and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee have determined that a majority of the boards members are independent directors as the term is defined in the Nasdaq Stock Market Marketplace Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors determined to be independent under this definition are: Lizabeth Ardisana, Ann B. Crane, Robert S. Cubbin, Steven G. Elliott, Gina D. France, John B. Gerlach, Jr., J. Michael Hochschwender, Chris Inglis, Peter J. Kight, Jonathan A. Levy, Eddie R. Munson, Richard W. Neu, David L. Porteous, and Kathleen H. Ransier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has determined that each member of the Audit, Compensation, and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees is independent under such definition and that the members of the Audit Committee are independent under the additional, more stringent requirements of the Nasdaq Stock Market applicable to audit committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making the independence determinations for each of the directors, the board took into consideration the transactions disclosed in this proxy statement under Review, Approval or Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the board of directors considered that the directors and their family members are customers of our affiliated financial and lending institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of the directors have one or more transactions, relationships or arrangements where Huntingtons affiliated financial and lending institutions, in the ordinary course of business, act as depository of funds, lender or trustee, or provide similar services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may also be affiliated with entities which are customers of our affiliated financial and lending institutions and which enter into transactions with such affiliates in the ordinary course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board also considered charitable donations to organizations in which directors have an interest, and the following relationships and transactions, and determined them to be immaterial: routine transactions and relationships entered into in the ordinary course of business between the Bank and business organizations with which Mr. Gerlach and Ms. Ransier, respectively, have an interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our chief executive officer, Stephen D. Steinour, serves as chairman of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director David L. Porteous has served as independent lead director since the board created the position in November 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board believes that having a combined chief executive officer and chairman along with a strong independent lead director provides an efficient and effective leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific responsibilities of the lead director are set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as liaison between the chairman of the board and the outside directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with the chairman of the board on information sent to the board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and providing input to the chairman of the board on board meeting agendas;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with the chairman of the board on meeting schedules to assure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at all meetings of the board at which the chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the outside directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: having the authority to call meetings of the outside directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensuring that he or she is available for consultation and direct communication with key stakeholders, if requested by the chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Porteous performs these duties and provides leadership in numerous additional ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is available to the chief executive officer as a sounding board for a variety of matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He meets regularly with Huntingtons regulators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He promotes good governance and fosters dialogue among the directors and between the board and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Porteous also takes an active role in outreach efforts with various constituents, including Huntington employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He regularly engages with the employees and acts as a liaison between employees and the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board believes that having an independent lead director performing these duties effectively complements and counterbalances the role of the combined chairman / chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interaction of the roles of the chairman / chief executive officer and the lead director is reflected in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Areas of Responsibility     Chair/CEO Role   Lead Director Role Full Board Meetings     Has the authority to call meetings of the board of directors     Participates in board meetings like every other director         Chairs meetings of the board of directors and the annual meeting of shareholders   Acts as intermediary  at times, the chair may refer to the lead director for guidance or to have something taken up in executive session           Provides leadership to the board of directors if circumstances arise in which the role of the chair may be, or may be perceived to be, in conflict with the board of directors              Suggests calling full board meetings to the chair when appropriate Executive Sessions     Receives feedback from the executive sessions   Has the authority to call meetings of the outside directors           Sets the agenda for and leads executive sessions of the outside directors             Briefs the CEO on issues arising out of the executive sessions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Agendas and Information     Takes primary responsibility for shaping board agendas, consulting with the lead director to ensure that board agendas and information provide the board with what is needed to fulfill its primary responsibilities   Collaborates with the chair to shape the board agenda and board information so that adequate time is provided for discussion of issues and so that appropriate information is made available to directors             Solicits agenda items from members of the board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Communications       Communicates with the directors on key issues and concerns outside of board meetings     Facilitates discussion among the outside directors on issues and concerns outside of board meetings         Takes responsibility for new director orientation and continuing education for the board of directors   Serves as a non-exclusive conduit to the chair of views, concerns, and issues of the outside directors             Coordinates with the chair on director orientation and continuing education Committee Meetings     Member of the Executive Committee and attends such other committee meetings (excluding executive sessions) as the chair shall so choose   Participates on such committees (including executive sessions) to which he is elected and is ex-officio member of all other committees             Chairs the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee which recommends the membership of various board committees as well as selection of committee chairs External and Other Stakeholders     Represents the organization to, and interacts with, external stakeholders, including investors, customers, employees and others   Available at the request of the chair to participate in meetings with key institutional investors           Makes periodic independent visits to business regions, meeting with employees and customers           Regularly meets independently with regulators             Has authority to engage advisors and consultants who report directly to the board of directors on board issues
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to having an engaged lead director, additional factors contribute to the boards comfort with Mr. Steinour serving in the combined roles of chairman and chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These factors include our strong corporate governance practices, our boards independence, and the accountability of the chief executive officer to the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive sessions, excluding the chairman and chief executive officer, are held in conjunction with each regularly scheduled board meeting to ensure open dialogue with the lead director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, there is regular reporting by senior management to the board of directors as further described under The Boards Role in Risk Oversight below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has also considered our leadership structure in light of the companys size, the nature of its business, the regulatory framework in which it operates, and its peers and determined that the boards leadership structure is appropriate for our company at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has defined our risk appetite as aggregate moderate-to-low and has established a comprehensive and coordinated risk oversight structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the board has three board committees that primarily oversee implementation of this desired risk appetite and the monitoring of our risk profile  the Risk Oversight Committee Audit Committee and the Technology Committee  the full board is engaged in discussing all risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors receives regular reports from every board committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noteworthy issues from each committee agenda are called to the attention of the full board in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all directors have access to information provided to each committee, and all scheduled committee meetings are open to all directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors regularly communicate directly with members of senior management as well as among the board and board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight Committee assists the board of directors in overseeing management of material risks, and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approval and monitoring of the companys capital position and plan supporting our overall aggregate moderate-to-low risk profile; the risk governance structure; compliance with applicable laws and regulations; and determining adherence to the boards stated risk appetite.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has oversight responsibility with respect to the full range of inherent risks: market, credit, liquidity, legal, compliance/regulatory, operational, strategic and reputational.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Committee also oversees our capital management and planning process, and ensures that the amount and quality of capital are adequate in relation to expected and unexpected risks and that our capital levels exceed well-capitalized requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight Committee receives reports directly from the chief risk office at least quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the integrity of the consolidated financial statements, including policies, procedures, and practices regarding the preparation of financial statements, the financial reporting process, disclosures, and internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also provides assistance to the board in overseeing the internal audit division and the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications and independence; compliance with our Financial Code of Ethics for the chief executive officer and senior financial officers; and compliance with corporate securities trading policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chief internal auditor reports directly to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight and Audit Committees routinely hold executive sessions with our key officers engaged in accounting and risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a regular basis, the two committees meet in joint session to cover matters relevant to both.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee assists the board of directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with respect to all technology, cyber security and third party risk management strategies and plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee is charged with evaluating Huntingtons capability to properly perform all technology functions necessary for its business plan, including projected growth, technology capacity, planning, operational execution, product development, and management capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee provides oversight of the technology segment investments and plans to drive efficiency as well as to meet defined standards for risk, security, and redundancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee oversees the allocation of technology costs and ensures that they are understood by the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee monitors and evaluates innovation and technology trends that may affect the Companys strategic plans, including monitoring of overall industry trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Technology Committee reviews and provides oversight of the companys continuity and disaster recovery planning and preparedness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chief technology officer and the chief information officer regularly attend meetings of the Technology Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, through its Compensation Committee, the board of directors seeks to ensure its system of rewards is risk- sensitive and aligns the interests of management, creditors, and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and evaluates the companys compensation policies and practices and the relationship among risk, risk management and compensation to ensure that incentive compensation practices appropriately balance risk and financial results, incentives do not expose the company to imprudent risks, the incentive programs are compatible with effective controls and risk management, are supported by strong corporate governance and the compensation policies are not likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee meets regularly with members of senior management, including the chief risk officer and the chief financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the Community Development Committee, the board oversees the companys compliance with fair lending obligations and Unfair, Deceptive or Abusive Acts and Practices (UDAAP) standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Community Development Committee has primary oversight of the companys commitments to the Community Reinvestment Act and the companys commitment to create and maintain a culture of inclusion that leverages diversity effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior compliance officers and the chief diversity and inclusion officer regularly participate in meetings of the Community Development Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of each of the board committees is further described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Strategy and Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full board of directors focuses direct oversight on risks related to company strategy and leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board holds an off-site session each year devoted to review of strategic priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the CEO reserves time at the beginning of each board meeting to discuss priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Periodically, special board sessions are held to discuss and analyze specific possible risk scenarios, such as cybersecurity incidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full board of directors oversees succession planning for the positions of the CEO and other members of the executive leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As selecting and appointing qualified executive leadership for the company is a priority for the board of directors, succession planning is discussed frequently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least annually, the CEO and the chief human resources officer review with the board the succession plans in place for executive leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also maintains succession plans for the positions reporting to the executive leadership team, and their direct reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continual Director Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington has established a formal training program for the board of directors to assist the board in its risk oversight function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The training program, which is overseen by the chief risk officer, covers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bank Secrecy Act (BSA)/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) issues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair lending responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avoidance of UDAAP (Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cyber risks and breaches; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Legal, regulatory and supervisory requirements and trends applicable to Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional topics may be included as appropriate, related to complex products, services or lines of business that have the potential to significantly impact the company and other topics as identified by the board of directors or executive management from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all board members are encouraged to participate in relevant external director education opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insights gained from these programs are shared with the full board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 6 directors attended conferences or seminars totaling approximately 125 hours of instruction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment of Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the companys compensation policies and practices and the relationship among risk, risk management and compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees oversight is supported by the Incentive Compensation Oversight Committee (the Oversight Committee), an executive level management committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Oversight Committee consists of senior management from Human Resources, Finance, Legal, Credit Administration, and Risk Management, and is co-chaired by the chief risk officer and the chief human resources officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Oversight Committee reports directly to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the direction of the Oversight Committee, Huntington performs an annual risk assessment of each incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The review includes economic analysis as well as evaluation of plan design features, risk balancing mechanisms, and governance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key tool for managing incentive compensation risk is an annual enterprise-level significant risk events review process overseen by the chief risk officer and the chief credit officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year-end significant risk events review typically results in a number of incentive payment adjustments, including several with respect to 2016 incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington uses a variety of plan design features to balance risk and rewards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance policies and practices also play an important role in managing incentive plan risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly monitor our incentive compensation arrangements for employees at all levels and strive to enhance our risk review in light of developing best practices and regulatory guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key broad-based incentive plan design features & controls include:      Other features and controls used in various plans include:   Recoupment / clawback provisions        Multiple performance criteria   Management discretion to reduce or eliminate awards        Risk-related performance criteria   Annual risk-based review of plans and awards        Payment caps        Hold-until-retirement or other termination provisions for equity grants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executive officers, our compensation philosophy balances risk and reward with a mix of base pay, short-term incentives and long-term incentives, with greater emphasis on long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain stock ownership guidelines for executives and impose a hold until retirement requirement of up to 50% of the net shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Compensation of Executive Officers below for detail about our executive compensation philosophy and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review, Approval or Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee of the board of directors oversees our Related Party Transactions Review and Approval Policy, referred to as the Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This written Policy covers related party transactions, including any financial transaction, arrangement or relationship or any series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships, either currently proposed or since the beginning of the last fiscal year in which we were or will be a participant, involving an amount exceeding $120,000 and in which a director, nominee for director, executive officer or his or her immediate family member has or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Policy requires our senior management and directors to notify the general counsel of any existing or potential related party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our general counsel reviews each reported transaction, arrangement or relationship that constitutes a related party transaction with the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee determines whether or not related party transactions are fair and reasonable for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also determines whether any related party transaction in which a director has an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: interest impairs the directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approved related party transactions are subject to on-going review by our management on at least an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Loans to directors and executive officers and their related interests made and approved pursuant to the terms of Federal Reserve Board Regulation O are deemed to be approved under this Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of these loans that become subject to specific disclosure in our annual proxy statement are reviewed by the Nominating
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and Corporate Governance Committee at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee would also consider and review any transactions with a shareholder having beneficial ownership of more than 5% of Huntingtons voting securities in accordance with the Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indebtedness of Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of our directors and executive officers and their immediate family members are customers of our affiliated financial and lending institutions in the ordinary course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
