sentences.text: In addition, our directors and executive officers also may be affiliated with entities which are customers of our affiliated financial and lending institutions in the ordinary course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Loan transactions with directors, executive officers and their immediate family members and affiliates have been made on substantially the same terms, including interest rates and collateral, as those prevailing at the time for comparable transactions with other customers otherwise not affiliated with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such loans also have not involved more than the normal risk of collectability or presented other unfavorable features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Other Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of our subsidiaries, Huntington Mezzanine Opportunities Inc., established in 2002 a private corporate mezzanine investment fund to provide financing in transaction amounts of up to $10 million to assist middle market companies primarily in the Midwest with growth or acquisition strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment fund was dissolved in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stonehenge Mezzanine Partners LLC, as its sole purpose, served as the asset manager of the fund through May 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After June 1, 2014 Stonehenge Mezzanine Partners LLC was entitled to receive 19.315% of amounts collected from any earn-out payments, escrow payments or other similar contingent payments related to other previous investments that had been held by the fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Stonehenge Mezzanine Partners LLC received $19,098 from earn-out/escrow payments/contingent payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director Michael J. Endres has a 12.6% equity interest in Stonehenge Mezzanine Partners LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Huntington National Bank has a $7.85 million commitment (reduced from $10 million) for an equity investment in the Stonehenge Opportunity Fund II, LP, a $150 million investment fund, which was organized in 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This funds origination period ended in 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, $6.36 million of the $7.85 million commitment has been funded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining $1.49 million commitment is limited to fund follow-on investments in existing portfolio companies and fund expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Huntington National Bank also has a $10 million commitment for an equity investment in the Stonehenge Opportunity Fund III, LP, a $250 million investment fund, which was organized in 2010, and a $15 million commitment for an equity investment in the Stonehenge Opportunity Fund IV, LP, a $250 million investment fund, which was organized in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, $7.2 million of the $10 million commitment to Stonehenge Opportunity Fund III, LP and $1 million of the $15 million commitment to Stonehenge Opportunity Fund IV, LP have been funded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stonehenge Opportunity Fund II, LP, the Stonehenge Opportunity Fund III, LP, and the Stonehenge Opportunity Fund IV, LP each operate as a Small Business Investment Company licensed by the Small Business Administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these funds seeks to generate long-term capital appreciation by investing in equity and, in certain cases, mezzanine securities of a diverse portfolio of companies across a variety of industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management determined that the investment would provide a cost effective means to participate in financing small businesses, provide a means of obtaining lending or investment credits under the Community Reinvestment Act and generally be favorable to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the funds is managed by Stonehenge Partners Corp., an investment firm of which Michael J. Endres is a principal and holds a 9.8% equity interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These funds pay to Stonehenge Partners Corp. management fees not to exceed on an annual basis 2.00% of the aggregate of private capital commitments and Small Business Administration debentures of the respective fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Stonehenge Partners Corp. is the controlling entity of Stonehenge Equity Partners, LLC, which serves as managing member of each of the funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paul McMahon has been employed by The Huntington National Bank since 2006 and currently serves as a Portfolio Manager  Team Lead in the Commercial Banking Department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McMahon is the son-in-law of director David L. Porteous.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McMahon serves in a non-executive capacity four reporting levels below the Commercial Banking Director, is one of approximately 16,500 employees, and is compensated in accordance with the employment compensation practices and policies applicable to all employees with equivalent qualifications and responsibilities in similar positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, Mr. McMahon received compensation of approximately $156,000 including base salary and incentive compensation, as well as benefits generally available to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of Outside Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy for the board of directors is to provide a compensation arrangement to outside directors that reflects the significant time commitment and substantial contributions the directors are expected to make to the value creation and governance of Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation level and structure are designed to enable us to attract and retain high caliber talent at a national level, and also to align the directors interests with those of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program for non-employee directors is a combination of cash and equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are also employees of Huntington do not receive compensation for their services as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees Payable in Cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director earns an annual retainer of $35,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay an additional annual retainer of $65,000 to the lead director, and $20,000 to the chairs of all standing board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay meeting fees at the standard rate of $2,000 for each board of directors or committee meeting the director attends and $1,000 for each teleconference board of directors or committee meeting in which the director participates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we pay directors fees of $2,000 per day in the event Huntington requests a director to attend or participate in an event or meeting, in person, in his capacity as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All fees are payable quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retainer fees are payable in four equal quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director may defer all or a portion of the cash compensation payable to the director if he or she elects to participate in the Deferred Compensation Plan and Trust for Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Directors, referred to as the Directors Deferred Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trustee of the plan has typically invested the trust fund primarily in shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors Deferred Plan is described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align the interests of directors with shareholders, a meaningful portion of director compensation is paid in equity that is subject to holding requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers equity grants for non-employee directors on an annual basis, and the form and amounts of any equity grants for directors are determined at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2006, the equity grants for directors have been in the form of deferred stock units which are vested upon grant but not released to the director until six months following separation of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the market data and peer review facilitated by the independent compensation consultant, the Compensation Committee granted each non-employee director a deferred stock award having a value of $105,000, effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Divided by the stock price of $10.06 on the last trading day preceding the date of grant, each director was awarded 10,437 deferred stock units, rounded down to the nearest whole share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee awarded an additional $20,000 grant value to the chairpersons of the Audit, Compensation and Risk Oversight Committees which converted to an additional 1,988 deferred stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the mandated holding of shares imposed by the deferred stock units, the Compensation Committee has established a minimum ownership level guideline for directors based on five times the annual retainer fee (excluding committee chairmanship retainers).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the retainer fee and the fair market value of our common stock on the date the guidelines were established, the guideline for directors was set at 40,603 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have five years to meet the minimum guidelines, from the date the guidelines were established, or if later, the date of joining the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the directors who has served at least two years has met the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors Deferred Plan allows the members of the board to elect to defer receipt of all or a portion of the compensation payable to them in the future for services as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We transfer cash equal to the compensation deferred pursuant to the plan to a trust fund where it is allocated to the accounts of the participating directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trustee of the plan has broad investment discretion over the trust fund and is authorized to invest in many forms of securities and other instruments, including our common stock.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the assets of the plan including the assets of the trust fund are subject to the claims of our creditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rights of a director or his or her beneficiaries to any of the assets of the plan are no greater than the rights of our unsecured general creditors.

sentences.text: Since directors who are also our employees do not receive compensation as directors, they are not eligible to participate in this plan.

sentences.text: Compensation of Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion & Analysis describes Huntingtons executive compensation program for 2016 for our named executive officers (NEOs) whose compensation is detailed in the Summary Compensation Table which follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of our board of directors provides independent oversight of our executive compensation and has engaged an independent compensation consultant, Pearl Meyer & Partners LLC, to provide advice with respect to the amount and form of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy is to pay for performance that creates long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has developed a balanced compensation program for executives that incorporates many key compensation and governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Compensation & Governance Practices    Significant stock ownership and hold until retirement policies that reinforce alignment between shareholders and executive officers    Significant emphasis on performance-based compensation, with majority of compensation dependent upon long-term performance   Balanced portfolio of metrics that drive annual and long-term goals in a risk appropriate manner    Annual cash incentive awards for executive officers  cash is capped at 100% of target; any award above target is paid in RSUs with a 3 year ratable vesting period   All incentive compensation subject to Recoupment and Clawback Policy   Performance Share Units comprise 50% of total annual LTI grant value    Hedging by executives is prohibited and pledging by executives and directors is restricted and discouraged; no shares are currently pledged   Independent compensation consultant advising the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Doing the Right Thing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also oversees the companys broader compensation policies and practices and the relationship among risk takers, risk management and compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington regularly monitors its incentive arrangements for employees at all levels and strives to enhance incentive risk management in light of developing best practices and regulatory guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk assessment of incentive compensation is discussed in greater detail above under The Boards Role in Risk Oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For years we have worked hard to build a culture of doing the right thing for our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fair play banking philosophy starts with doing the right thing with products and services that are simple, clear, and fair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also look to deepen existing customer relationships by working to understand and serve our customers needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a proud legacy of strong customer service and we require that all of our colleagues follow both the letter and intent of our code of business conduct and ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We take action when we find violations of our code of conduct, and violations are reported to the audit committee of the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, Huntington maintains a robust Recoupment and Clawback Policy which is a tool for recoupment or clawback of incentive compensation in appropriate situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees at all levels in the organization are subject to this
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive compensation subject to possible clawback or recoupment includes any cash incentive or equity compensation, vested or unvested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, situations that trigger a review under this policy involve behaviors or actions outside the bounds of the companys overall risk appetite and governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee would make any incentive recoupment or clawback determination with respect to executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional detail about the Recoupment and Clawback Policy can be found later in this discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Importance of Stock Ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A critical foundation of our executive compensation philosophy is the requirement to own Huntington common stock, which aligns managements interests with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Steinours commitment to this principle and to the company is evidenced by his significant personal investment in Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since joining Huntington in January 2009, Mr. Steinour has purchased over 1.5 million shares of Huntington common stock in open market transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Steinour directly and indirectly owned shares of Huntington common stock equal to approximately 41X his salary, significantly exceeding our best practice 6X salary ownership guideline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive officer generally has 5 years to comply with his or her requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, executive officers are subject to a holding requirement equal to 50% of net shares received upon the exercises of a stock option or upon the release of full value awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount of shares must be held until retirement or other departure from the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See additional detail under Stock Ownership & Holding Requirements later in this discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Say-on-Pay / Shareholder Outreach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 95% of the votes cast for our say-on-pay advisory vote at the 2016 annual meeting were in favor of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to continually strengthen our compensation practices based on our philosophy, market best practices and feedback received from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we continued our shareholder outreach and held conversations with investors holding approximately 25% of our outstanding common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and management have gained valuable insight from these interactions and will continue to seek shareholder input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the say-on-pay vote and other feedback, the Compensation Committee has determined to maintain the essential design of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to monitor emerging trends and best practices and seek ways to improve our compensation programs and ensure continued alignment between our pay and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview

sentences.text: Our Business Strategy, Goals and Accomplishments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2009, Huntington developed a strategic plan for its core businesses, the primary objective of which was to increase market share and share of wallet in the markets we serve, while recognizing the need to create a balanced executional focus on four key constituencies: Customers, Colleagues, Communities and Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Execution of the strategy has positioned Huntington as an industry leader in growth of households and share of wallet, with further opportunities to grow market share and share of wallet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the financial services industry is currently being significantly impacted by the substantial effect that regulation and economic conditions have on profitability and competitive position, Huntingtons 2016 performance was strong.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 we demonstrated continued progress toward achieving our long-term financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered positive operating leverage for the fourth consecutive year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenue increased 18% over the prior year, materially aided by the acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation in August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net charge-offs remained below our long-term goal for the third consecutive year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also executed our balance sheet optimization strategy, in which we chose to shrink the balance sheet in order to replenish our capital ratios more quickly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a historic, and in many ways transformational, year for Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We celebrated the 150th anniversary of The Huntington National Bank, proudly serving our local communities for generations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We completed the largest acquisition in our companys history, FirstMerit Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also eclipsed two meaningful financial milestones for the first time as total assets exceeded $100 billion, and quarterly revenue exceeded $1 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And, we added extraordinary talent and new growth opportunities with new products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with Huntingtons pay for performance philosophy, the Compensation Committees 2016 compensation program for executive officers emphasized performance-based compensation.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philosophy and Decision-Making Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee develops and approves our executive compensation with input from our management and the independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management provides information and may make recommendations to the Compensation Committee with respect to the amount and form of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our CEO and CFO make recommendations to the Compensation Committee when it sets specific financial measures and goals for determining incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO provides input and makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding the performance and compensation of his direct reports, which include the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO does not
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: make recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding his own compensation, other than requests in prior years that the Compensation Committee defer consideration of a base salary increase for him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, the Compensation Committee consults with other committees of the board and may obtain the approval of the full board of directors with respect to certain executive and director compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail, see Procedures for Determining Executive and Director Compensation; Compensation Consultant in the Corporate Governance section above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a balanced total compensation package, which includes both fixed and variable, performance-based elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of both short-term and long-term incentives ensures that the ultimate compensation delivered is dependent upon achievement of our annual business goals, as well as delivering long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance and evaluation process considers company, business segment and individual performance, as well as performance relative to industry peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our target pay levels are designed to be competitive with market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since a majority of our pay is variable and based on performance, our actual pay positioning will vary appropriately to reflect our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While overall compensation policies generally apply to all executives, we recognize the need to differentiate compensation by individual, reflecting on his or her role, experience, performance, and expected contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries and incentive targets are the primary means for differentiating compensation opportunities to reflect executive role and scope of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Mr. Steinour has a higher base salary and higher potential award opportunities due to his responsibilities as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also held to a higher stock ownership guideline, reflecting his increased stake in our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guiding Principles Focus on long-term shareholder alignment   A significant portion of compensation is stock-based and long-term in focus Approach compensation in a balanced and holistic fashion   Our program includes fixed and performance-based elements, short-term and long-term performance incentives, and considers corporate, business segment, individual, and relative performance Vary pay based on performance   Total compensation is expected to vary each year and may evolve over the long-term to reflect our performance and key objectives Maintain an aggregate moderate-to-low risk profile   We monitor our programs, controls and governance practices for consistency with our aggregate moderate-to-low risk profile   See Risk Assessment of Incentive Plans above Assure appropriate positioning in the market   Our target pay levels are designed to be competitive with market practice.

sentences.text: Reflect internal equity   We differentiate compensation by individual, reflecting his or her role, experience, performance and expected contributions

sentences.text: Market Referencing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee regularly reviews peer and industry information in regard to levels of compensation and performance as a competitive frame of reference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses this information and analysis as a benchmarking reference for setting pay opportunities and making pay decisions, such as changes to base salaries, annual incentive awards and long-term incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key source of information is a peer group of regional banks similar to Huntington in terms of size and business model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer banks are chosen using an objective process recommended by the independent compensation consultant and approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal year 2016 and in anticipation of the FirstMerit acquisition, the Compensation Committee approved two groups of peer banks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first peer group has a frame of reference for understanding compensation levels and program design before the acquisition of FirstMerit and the second peer group was used for the same purposes following the acquisition of FirstMerit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We re-evaluated and updated the peer group in 2016 for ongoing relevance, as we do each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process began with the selection of U.S. based publicly traded commercial banks considering asset size as of December 31, 2015.

sentences.text: The three primary components of executive compensation are base salary, annual incentive awards and equity- based long-term incentive awards.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Components    Purpose and Key Features Base Salary    Set within a competitive range of market practice to attract and retain top talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Varies depending upon the executives role, performance, experience and contribution   Foundation from which incentives and other benefits are determined Annual Incentive (Management Incentive Plan)    Motivate and reward for achieving or exceeding annual financial strategic and operational goals that ultimately support sustained long-term profitable growth and value creation   Reflect company performance on key measures, adjusted for business unit and individual performance, including risk management   Each NEO has a target opportunity expressed as a percentage of base salary reflective of the NEOs role   Tied directly to performance in year for which reported   Awards up to target are paid in cash; any amount of annual incentive earned in excess of target is paid in the form of RSUs which vest incrementally over three years Long-Term Incentive (Equity Grants)    Motivate and reward for delivering long-term sustained performance aligned with shareholder interests   Grants are comprised of performance share units (PSUs), time-based restricted stock units (RSUs) and stock options   Awards based on multiple factors, including competitive market data, business segment performance, individual performance and historical equity grants Benefits    Same broad-based benefit programs generally available to all employees   A limited number of additional benefits are offered targeted to be within typical market practice and as needed to attract and retain executive talent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timing of Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February of each year, the Compensation Committee approves annual incentive awards which are tied directly to prior year performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are based on metrics chosen by the Compensation Committee the preceding February.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the second quarter of the year, the Compensation Committee makes decisions with respect to base salary adjustments and equity-based long-term incentive based on performance and on other factors discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the incentive compensation amounts reported for 2016 in the Summary Compensation Table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentives determined in February 2017 based on 2016 performance are reported under the Non-Equity Incentive Plan column.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives granted on May 1, 2016 are based on a multi-faceted approach that includes company and individual performance and contributions, retention value of current equity ownership, historical long-term incentive compensation awards and the market-based framework the independent consultant developed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are reported under the columns Stock Awards and Option Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion of compensation decisions with respect to base salary adjustments, annual incentive awards under MIP and annual equity grants below is applicable to each of the NEOs other than Sandra E. Pierce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Pierce oined Huntington in August 2016 upon Huntingtons acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation, as Private Client Group Director, Regional Banking Director and Senior Executive Vice President of the Huntington National Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Much of Ms. Pierces compensation was paid pursuant to the retention letter negotiated with her in connection with the transaction and Huntingtons decision to retain her, and is discussed under Compensation Decisions below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A portion of Ms. Pierces compensation was determined by FirstMerit Corporation prior to the acquisition by Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the NEOs then serving received a merit-based salary increase effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increase for the CEO was equal to 10% of base salary, and the increases for the other NEOs ranged from 3.8% to 6.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increase for the CEO was the first since his hire in 2009; for several years after joining the company, the CEO expressed a desire to not be considered for a base salary increase, which was honored by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All salary increases were market competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntingtons annual incentive awards under the Management Incentive Plan reflect company performance on key short-term measures, adjusted in the discretion of the CEO and the Compensation Committee, for business segment and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the appropriate corporate performance metrics for each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metrics for 2016 were determined by the Compensation Committee to be earnings per share, return on tangible common equity, and operating leverage, which were the same metrics selected for 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance metrics were chosen from among the list of available criteria under MIP and represented key short-term strategic areas of focus intended to support long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The choice of metrics also reflected a balanced approach to measuring success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metric of operating leverage ensures that our incentives are aligned with our commitment to shareholders to grow revenue faster than expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on tangible common equity (ROTCE) was chosen due to the strong correlation of higher ROTCE to higher market price-to-tangible book value (P/TBV) valuations for the common stocks of publicly-traded bank holding companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive has an annual target incentive opportunity expressed as a percentage of his or her base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific threshold, target and maximum opportunity for each executive is reflective of the executives role and competitive market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the CEOs target incentive was equal to 125% of his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the other participating NEOs, the 2016 MIP target was equal to 80% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each metric the Compensation Committee determined a threshold, target, and maximum level of achievement based on the companys operating plan for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MIP allows for awards to be earned under each plan criterion, independent of the other criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We interpolate between the threshold, target, and maximum goals to ensure sound incentive compensation arrangements and appropriate pay for performance alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether a performance goal has been met, the Committee will include or exclude extraordinary events or any other objective events or occurrences, in either establishing the performance goal based on the qualifying performance criteria or in determining whether the performance goal has been achieved; provided, however, that the Committee retains the discretion to reduce or eliminate an award that would otherwise be paid to any participant based on the Committees evaluation of such events or other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may be paid only after the Compensation Committee has certified in writing that the performance goals have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the 2016 cycle of MIP included an individual funding mechanism for each of the participating NEOs, excluding the CFO, equal to a maximum of 0.5% of net income for the CEO and a maximum of 0.2% of net income for the other participating NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards would have been paid to these select NEOs if positive net income had not been achieved for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys 2016 performance was reviewed in accordance with the MIP and certified by the Compensation Committee in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excluding significant items, actual performance against the EPS goal was above target, and actual performance against the ROTCE and Operating Leverage goals exceeded the maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below provides the schedule of metrics and goals that the Compensation Committee approved for 2016, along with the companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Metric   Weight    Threshold   Target    Maximum    2016 Performance    Calculated Performance Factor EPS        30%   $ 0.78   $ 0.87   $ 0.95   $ 0.910         133% ROTCE     30%     11.50%   12.50%    13.50%    13.72%    200% Operating Leverage         40%     0.1%    0.5%    1.7%    4.65%            200% % of Target     100%                              180%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments for Individual Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final award for the CEO may be adjusted for his individual performance at the discretion of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to limits for deducting compensation expenses under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m), the award for the CEO could have been adjusted downward or upward within the overall parameters of MIP, but not increased above the individual funding factor of 0.5% of net income (approximately $3,426,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final awards for the other NEOs may be adjusted, at the discretion of the CEO and the Compensation Committee, for business segment and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to limits for deducting compensation expenses under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m), awards for Mr. Heller, and Ms. Houston could have been adjusted downward or upward within the overall parameters of MIP, but not increased above the individual funding factor of 0.2% of net income (approximately $1,370,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the position of CFO is not a covered officer under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m), the award for Mr. McCullough was not subject to a cap other than the $7,500,000 limit for any award granted under the terms of the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of each award that exceeded target was converted and paid in RSUs based on the closing price of a share of common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final awards for the NEOs are discussed below under Compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining LTI Grant Value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee engaged the independent compensation consultant to develop long-term incentive award ranges based on competitive market practice to serve as guidelines for annual grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to these guidelines, when determining award ranges for individual executive officers, the Compensation Committee considers the impact on potential total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award opportunities are within a range defined by a low to high percentage of base salary to allow for awards to vary in order to reflect individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These ranges are exclusive of RSUs paid as a portion of MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Value Range for Potential Equity Grants CEO   162.5% to 650% of base salary CFO   107.5% to 430% of base salary Other Participating NEOs  80% to 320% of base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTI Grant Vehicles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 grants, management proposed, and the Compensation Committee approved the strategy set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All equity vehicles are subject to our Share Ownership and Share Holding Policy provisions for the executive leadership team: 50% of net shares released upon vesting or exercise are required to be held to retirement or other departure from the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Long-Term Incentive Program Highlights Vehicle   % of Total LTI Value    Key Design Features   Performance Share Units    50%         Performance Measurement Period: 3 years        Performance Measures:        Relative Adjusted Return on Tangible Common Equity (ROTCE, 50% weighting)        Relative Total Shareholder Return (TSR, 50% weighting)        Share Payout Range: 0  150% of target     Restricted Stock Units    35%         Vesting: 50% in year 3 and 50% in year 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options      15%           Vesting: 4 year annual pro-rata        Option Term: 10 years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design of PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With assistance from the independent consultant, the Compensation Committee selected the same two metrics for the PSUs granted in 2016 as used in 2015: return on tangible common equity (ROTCE) and TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 grant, the goals for both metrics are relative to the performance of peers in order to alleviate goal setting challenges due to the then-pending acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company believes ROTCE and TSR are key factors to long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is a strong correlation of higher ROTCEs to higher market price-to-tangible book value (P/TBV) valuations for the common stock of publicly-traded bank holding companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR aligns long-term incentive compensation to value created for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reflected in the table below, the Compensation Committee determined a threshold, target and maximum level of achievement for the three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In calculating performance to determine whether a performance goal has been achieved, the Compensation Committee will adjust for Extraordinary Events as defined in the 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSU Metric    Threshold Percentile    Target Percentile    Maximum Percentile  Relative TSR      35th      50th      65th  Relative ROTCE      35th      50th      65th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR will be measured over the length of the cycle, from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROTCE results are measured annually, adjusted for extraordinary items, and averaged using year-end reported amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range of potential payouts, 0% to 150% of the target number of share units, was consistent with the design of PSUs awarded in the prior year, and determined to be within competitive market practice, and reasonable from an annual share run rate and dilution perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of individual LTI Grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee independently evaluated the CEOs performance for the purpose of determining a 2016 long-term incentive award and assessed the competitive pay positioning that would result from the awards to be consistent with our pay-for-performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining award values for the other NEOs, the Compensation Committee considered the CEOs performance assessments for each NEO, as well as additional input from the CEO, and the market guidelines provided by the consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the companys philosophy, the chief executive officers evaluation was based on a holistic approach that included individual performance and contributions, retention value of current equity ownership, historical long-term incentive compensation awards and the market-based framework the independent consultant developed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key factors included in the evaluation of each NEO are discussed under Compensation Decisions for each Named Executive Officer below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved awards in 2016 for the NEOs, excluding the chief executive officer, as recommended by the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Pierce received an equity retention award granted to her by Huntington pursuant to the retention letter between Ms. Pierce and Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Decisions for each Named Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When considering base salary increases, adjusting MIP awards for business segment and individual performance, and determining the grant-date value of long-term incentive compensation awards, the CEO and Compensation Committee considered the performance of each executive under the following common factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common Performance Factors:      financial and operating results        strategic planning and implementation        risk management and key metrics        organization/colleagues        continuous improvement        community/stakeholder relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Compensation Committee differentiated compensation for the NEOs other than the CEO by taking into consideration the CEOs evaluation of each executives performance, role and relative contribution to overall company performance.

sentences.text: Although there were no predetermined quantifiable goals against which business unit and individual performance were evaluated independently for purposes of determining compensation, highlights of the specific 2016 individual and business unit performance considered by the Compensation Committee for each NEO are set forth below.

sentences.text: Sandra E. Pierce, Private Client Group Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Pierce joined Huntington as Private Client Group Director, Regional Banking Director and Senior Executive Vice President of The Huntington National Bank, effective upon the completion of the acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation in August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Pierce previously served as Vice Chairman of FirstMerit Corporation and as Chairman and CEO of FirstMerit Michigan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Ms. Pierces joining Huntington upon the completion of the merger, the Compensation Committee entered into a retention letter with Ms. Pierce which provides for a base salary equal to $594,104 subject to adjustment in accordance with the policies as in effect from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the retention letter approved by the Compensation Committee provides for several payments to compensate Ms. Pierce for certain payments and benefits to which she would have been entitled under her change-in-control agreement with FirstMerit upon a qualifying termination of employment during the 30 month period following the change-in-control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments consisted of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a cash retention bonus credited or to be credited to Ms. Pierces account under Huntingtons Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, which is fully vested and will be paid to Ms. Pierce upon any termination of her employment that constitutes a Separation of Service under Section 409A of the tax code and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) an equity retention grant, in the form of an RSU award, credited or to be credited to Ms. Pierces account under Huntingtons Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a cash credit to Ms. Pierces account under the 2008 FirstMerit Corporation Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the completion of Huntingtons acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation, Ms. Pierce participated in FirstMerits 2013 Annual Incentive Plan pursuant to which she was eligible to receive a cash bonus based on FirstMerits performance and her individual performance during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the terms of the merger agreement between Huntington and FirstMerit Corporation, immediately prior to the completion of Huntingtons acquisition of FirstMerit, FirstMerit determined Ms. Pierces annual bonus for 2016 based on performance through the date of the closing, and annualized for the full year, in an amount equal to $805,949.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A limited number of additional benefits are offered to executive officers and certain other officers and are designed to represent a modest portion of total compensation.

sentences.text: Following is a list of the additional benefits and compensation elements offered to executive officers during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental Savings: The NEOs are eligible to participate in a supplemental defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is further discussed following the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation 2016 table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation: Our Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, a non-qualified plan, provides a vehicle for participants to defer receipt of cash or stock to a time when taxes may be at a more personally beneficial rate and / or to save for long-term financial needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is discussed in more detail following the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation 2016 table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites: A very limited number of perquisites are utilized at Huntington; they represent a small component of compensation and are not intended to be performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer an incurred expense reimbursement allowance for tax and financial planning to our NEOs, up to 2% of base salary per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the chief executive officer, we provide security monitoring of his personal residence, and for efficiency and security, use of our cars and drivers and occasional use of a corporate aircraft to which the company has access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All personal use of the corporate aircraft is in accordance with Huntingtons Aircraft Usage Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide relocation benefits to senior level employees to facilitate transition to their new locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement: Only one executive officer, the CEO, has an employment agreement with us, which was renewed effective December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreement is described under Mr. Steinours Employment Agreement below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Arrangements: Huntington has change-in-control agreements, referred to as Executive Agreements, with our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of the Executive Agreements are to provide severance protections for the NEOs in the event of a qualifying termination of employment in connection with a change-in-control of Huntington and to encourage their continued employment in the event of any actual or threatened change-in-control of Huntington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Agreements are further described under Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frozen Supplemental Pension: NEOs who are participants in the frozen pension plan (frozen on December 31, 2013) are participants in a supplemental defined benefit plan that was also frozen on the same date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is further discussed under the Pension Benefits 2016 table, below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership & Holding Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee first established stock ownership requirements, expressed as a number of shares, for executive officers in 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2016, the Compensation Committee adopted a value-based approach pursuant to which executives are required to meet and maintain a dollar value of ownership based on a multiple of current salary rather than a prescribed number of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will provide a consistent measure for all executives without regard to the date an executive becomes subject to the requirements and reduces the impact of stock price fluctuations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership levels are evaluated annually based on then current stock prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executives current base salary will be multiplied by his or her assigned multiple and compared to current holdings, valued based on a 30-day average closing stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After becoming subject to the guidelines, executives generally have five years to meet their ownership levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thereafter,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executives must continue to meet their requirements on an on-going basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers continue to be subject to a holding requirement equal to 50% of net shares received upon the exercises of a stock option or upon the release of full value awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount of shares must be held until retirement or other departure from the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may permit a discretionary hardship exemption from the ownership and / or holding requirements, on a case-by-case basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging & Pledging Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has a policy prohibiting Huntingtons executive officers from hedging their ownership of Huntington stock, as this would be inconsistent with the goals of the compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibited hedging activity ncludes trading in financial instruments designed to hedge or offset any decrease in the market value of Huntington stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These financial instruments include prepaid variable forward contracts, equity swaps, collars and exchange funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, executive officers and directors are generally discouraged from pledging their Huntington securities, however they may pledge shares owned in excess of stock ownership guidelines with the consent of the General Counsel Any such request, along with the General Counsels response, must be communicated to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of Huntingtons executive officers or directors currently has shares of Huntington stock pledged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Long-Term Incentive Award Grant Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may designate a grant date effective following the date of the committee action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice is followed in the event the trading window is closed pursuant to the companys trading policies on the date the committee acts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2012 we have granted our annual long-term incentive awards effective May 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price for each stock option award is equal to the fair market value of a share of common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the companys stock plan, fair market value is generally defined as the closing price on the applicable date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have never repriced stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoupment / Clawback Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Recoupment / Clawback Policy is a tool for recoupment or clawback of incentive compensation in appropriate situations to the extent permitted (or required) by law and by the companys plans, policies and agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Compensation subject to possible clawback or recoupment includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) any bonus or other cash incentive payment, including commissions, previously paid or payable, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) any equity compensation, vested or unvested (including without limitation, performance shares and performance share units, restricted stock and restricted stock units, and stock options), and net proceeds of any exercised or vested equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, situations that trigger a review under this policy involve behaviors or actions outside the bounds of the companys overall risk appetite and governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to require reimbursement or forfeiture o an executive officers incentive compensation, the Compensation Committee shall take into account such considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as it deems appropriate, such as the extent to which the employees actions or inactions were in violation of the code of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conduct; whether the action or inaction could reasonably be expected to cause financial or reputational harm to the company; the egregiousness of the conduct; the tax consequences to the affected employee; and other factors as the Committee deems appropriate under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For employees who are not executive officers, the decision to recoup or clawback incentive compensation is made by the CEO jointly with the Chief Human Resources Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific provisions apply in the event of a financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If it is determined by the board of directors that gross negligence, intentional misconduct or fraud by an employee or former employee caused or partially caused the company to have to restate all or a portion of its financial statements, the board, in its sole discretion, may, to the extent permitted by law and the companys benefit plans, policies and agreements, and to the extent it determined in its sole judgment that it is in the best interests of the company to do so, require repayment of a portion or all of any Incentive Compensation if (1) the amount or vesting of the Incentive Compensation was calculated based upon, or contingent on, the achievement of financial or operating results that were the subject of or affected by the restatement; and (2) the amount or vesting of the Incentive Compensation would have been less had the financial statements been correct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, pursuant to Section 954 of the Dodd-Frank Act, if the company is required to restate any of its financial statements because of a material financial reporting violation, the company shall recover the amount in excess of the incentive compensation payable under the companys restated financial statements, or such other amount required under the Dodd-Frank Act or any other applicable law or policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company shall recover this amount from any current or former employee who received incentive compensation during the three-year period preceding the date on which the restatement is required, or from any other individual specified in the Dodd-Frank Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have included clawback provisions in incentive plans for executive officers and for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For NEOs our recoupment and clawback policies include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have forfeiture and recoupment provisions in the 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan specific to awards under these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except following a change in control event, should the Compensation Committee determine that a participant has committed a serious breach of conduct or has solicited or taken away customers or potential customers with whom the participant had contact during the participants employment with us, the Compensation Committee may terminate any outstanding award, in whole or in part, whether or not yet vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such conduct or activity occurs within three years following the exercise or payment of an award, the Compensation Committee may require the participant or former participant to repay to us any gain realized or payment received upon exercise or payment of such award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A serious breach of conduct includes, without limitation, any conduct prejudicial to or in conflict with Huntington or any securities law violations including any violations under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, awards may be forfeited upon termination of employment for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management Incentive Plan provides that if Huntington is required to restate any of its financial statements because of a material financial reporting violation, Huntington will recover the amount in excess of the award payable under Huntingtons restated financial statements, or such other amount required under the Dodd-Frank Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if the Compensation Committee determines that a participant took unnecessary or excessive risk, manipulated earnings, or engaged in any misconduct described in our Recoupment Policy, the Committee may terminate the participants participation in the plan and require repayment of any amount previously paid in accordance with the Recoupment Policy, any other applicable policies and any other applicable laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 954 of Dodd-Frank requires new listing standards related to recovery of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors will review its recoupment policies in light of these new standards when they are adopted by NASDAQ, and as other rules and best practices develop.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax & Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have worked to balance our compensation philosophy with the goal of achieving maximum deductibility under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Management Incentive Plan and our 2015 Long-Term Incentive Plan have been structured so that awards under these plans for covered officers may qualify as performance-based compensation deductible for federal income tax purposes under Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has also reserved the right, however, with respect to any award or awards, to determine that compliance with Code Section 162(m) is not desired after consideration of the goals of Huntingtons executive compensation philosophy and whether it is in the best interests of Huntington to have such award so qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington also takes into consideration Internal Revenue Code Section 409A with respect to non-qualified deferred compensation programs, and ASC 718, Compensation  Stock Compensation in administering its equity compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Supplemental Plan is to provide a supplemental savings program for eligible employees (as determined by the Compensation Committee) who are unable to continue to make contributions to the Huntington Investment and Tax Savings Plan, a tax qualified 401(k) plan referred to as the 401(k) Plan, for part of the year because the individual has: (I) contributed the maximum amount permitted by the Internal Revenue Service for the calendar year ($18,000 in 2016); or (II) received the maximum amount of compensation permitted to be taken into account by the Internal Revenue Service for the calendar year ($265,000 in 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan and the Supplemental Plan work together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an employee elects to participate in the 401(k) Plan, he or she designates the percentage between 1% and 75% of base pay on a pre-tax, Roth after tax, or a combination of pre-tax and Roth after-tax basis that is to be contributed to the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions to the 401(k) Plan are automatically deducted from the employees pay and then allocated to the employees 401(k) Plan account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we matched 100% on the first 4% of base compensation deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental Plan generally works the same way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a participant elects to participate in the Supplemental Plan, he or she designates the percentage of base pay that is to be contributed to the Supplemental Plan  between 1% and 75% of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All contributions to the Supplemental Plan must be on a pre-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then match contributions according to the same formula used by the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 401(k) Plan, employees can invest their contributions and our matching contributions in any of 30 investment alternatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Supplemental Plan, employee pre-tax contributions and our matching contributions are generally invested in Huntington common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant cannot receive a distribution of any part of his account in the Supplemental Plan until his or her employment terminates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once employment terminates, the account in the Supplemental Plan is required to be distributed to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Portions of accounts invested in our common stock are distributed in shares of common stock and the remaining portions are distributed in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions from the Supplemental Plan are subject to federal and state ncome tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EDCP provides senior officers designated by the Compensation Committee the opportunity to defer up to 90% of base salary, annual bonus compensation and certain equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An election to defer can only be made on an annual basis and is generally irrevocable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the one-time cash contribution made by Huntington in 2016 for Ms. Pierce, contributions to this plan consist of compensation deferred by the participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferrals of common stock are held as common stock until distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash amounts deferred will accrue interest, earnings and losses based on the performance of the investment option selected by the participant and tracked by a book-keeping account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment options consist of common stock and a variety of mutual funds that are generally available and/or consistent with the types of investment options under the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of each deferral election, a participant elects the method and timing of account distribution in the event of termination or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a participant may elect an in-service distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounts distributed upon termination, retirement or in-service event may be distributed in a single lump sum payment or in substantially equal installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may request a hardship withdrawal prior to termination or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, for amounts earned and vested on or before December 31, 2004, a participant may obtain an in-service withdrawal subject to a 10% penalty and suspension of future contributions for at least 12 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash that is deferred is paid out in cash, except that any cash that is invested in our common stock at the time of distribution is distributed in shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common stock that is deferred is distributed in kind.
