sentences.text: Payments upon Termination of Employment or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our named executive officers has a change in control agreement with us referred to as an Executive Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of these agreements are to encourage retention of our key executives and to provide protection from termination related to a change in control of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntingtons board of directors adopted the current forms of agreement in November 2012 when they were updated to more closely align with current best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary changes from the prior agreements were the elimination of the golden parachute excise tax gross-up provision and the elimination of a provision that provided the executive serving as chief executive officer with the right to terminate employment solely as a result of a change-in-control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the updated agreements contain restrictions relating to the disclosure of confidential information and competing with Huntington (three year non-competition for the chief executive officer, and one year non-competition for the other named executive officers, post termination).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Huntington has an employment agreement with Mr. Steinour pursuant to which Mr. Steinour will continue to serve as Huntingtons president and chief executive officer through December 31, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement became effective December 1, 2012 for an initial three-year term, subject to three-year renewal periods upon expiration of the initial term and each renewal term, unless either party gives timely notice of nonrenewal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Steinours employment agreement provides for certain payments to him upon termination in certain situations other than a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of the named executive officers has outstanding RSU awards and PSU awards which may be subject to accelerated vesting upon involuntary termination (not for cause), death, or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Executive Agreements, change in control generally includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the acquisition by any person of beneficial ownership of 25% or more of our outstanding voting securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a change in the composition of the board of directors if a majority of the new directors were not appointed or nominated by the directors currently sitting on the board of directors or their subsequent nominees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a merger involving our company where our shareholders immediately prior to the merger own less than 51% of the combined voting power of the surviving entity immediately after the merger;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the dissolution of our company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a disposition of assets, reorganization, or other corporate event involving our company which would have the same effect as any of the above-described events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under each Executive Agreement, we, or our successor, will provide severance benefits to the executive officer if his mployment is terminated (other than on account of the officers death or disability or for cause):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by us, at any time within 24 months after a change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by us, at any time prior to a change in control but after commencement of any discussions with a third party relating to a possible change in control involving such third party if the executive officers termination is in contemplation of such possible change in control and such change in control is actually consummated within 12 months after the date of such executive officers termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by the executive officer voluntarily with good reason at any time within 24 months after a change in control of our company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by the executive officer voluntarily with good reason at any time after commencement of change in control discussions if such change in control is actually consummated within 12 months after the date of such officers termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good reason generally means the assignment to the executive officer of duties which are materially different from such duties prior to the change in control, a reduction in such officers salary or benefits, or a demand to relocate to an unacceptable location, made by us or our successor either after a change in control or after the commencement of change n control discussions if such change or reduction is made in contemplation of a change in control and such change in control is actually consummated within 12 months after such change or reduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive officers determination of good reason will be conclusive and binding upon the parties if made in good faith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to any accrued salary and annual cash incentive payable as of termination, severance payments and benefits under the Executive Agreements consist of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum cash payment equal to three times annual base salary for the chief executive officer and two and one-half times annual base salary for each of the other named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum cash payment equal to three times for the chief executive officer, and two and one-half times for the other named executive officers, of the greater of the executives target annual incentive award for the calendar year during which the change in control occurs or the immediately preceding calendar year, provided the executive was a participant in the Management incentive Plan during the calendar year, or the immediately preceding calendar year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a pro-rata annual incentive award paid upon a change in control under the Management Incentive Plan based on either the actual level of year-to-date performance, or the target award as a percent of base salary for the plan year preceding the change in control, whichever is greater, in accordance with the terms of the Management Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 36 months of continued insurance benefits for the chief executive officer, and 30 months for the other named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: fees for outplacement services for the executive up to a maximum amount equal to 15% of the executives annual base salary plus reimbursement for job search travel expenses up to $5,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock options, restricted stock, RSU, and PSU awards under our stock and incentive plans become vested according to the terms of the plans; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other benefits to which the executive was otherwise entitled including perquisites, benefits, and service credit for benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Agreements also provide for 36 months of additional service credited for purposes of retirement benefits for the chief executive officer and 30 months for the other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Retirement Plan and the SRIP were frozen as of December 31, 2013, this provision will not operate to increase accrued benefits under hese plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional service and compensation earned after the freeze date are not included in the calculation of benefits under the Executive Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The additional service period will count for purposes of determining vesting or entitlement to early retirement benefits under these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Agreements have a best-net-benefit clause which replaced the excise tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an executive triggers the excise tax, the individual will either be cut-back to an amount that is $1 less than such amount that would cause the excise tax, or the executive will have the opportunity to pay the excise tax himself, depending on the result that provides the better after-tax result.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a period of five years after any termination of the executive officers employment, we will provide the executive officer with coverage under a standard directors and officers liability insurance policy at our expense, and will indemnify, hold harmless, and defend the officer to the fullest extent permitted under Maryland law against all expenses and liabilities reasonably incurred by the officer in connection with or arising out of any action, suit, or proceeding in which he may be involved by reason of having been a director or officer of our company or any subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event an executive officer is required to enforce any of the rights granted under his Executive Agreement, we, or our successor, will pay the cost of counsel (legal and accounting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the executive officer is entitled to prejudgment interest on any amounts found to be due in connection with any action taken to enforce such officers rights under the Executive Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a condition to receiving the payments and benefits under the Executive Agreements, the executive officer will be required to execute a release.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance benefits payable in a lump sum will be paid not later than 45 business days following the date the executives employment terminates, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Agreements are extended annually and are subject to an extension for 24 months upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Executive Agreement will terminate if the executive officers employment terminates under circumstances that do not trigger benefits under the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may elect not to renew an agreement upon 30 days prior written notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sandra Pierce
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the completion of Huntingtons acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation, Huntington entered into a retention letter with Ms. Pierce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retention letter provided that if Ms. Pierces employment was terminated by Huntington without cause or if she died or became disabled prior to February 16, 2017, Huntington would contribute a cash amount equal to $1,750,065 to her account under the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan that would become payable upon her separation from service with Huntington (the Contingent Cash Retention Award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefit was intended to make Ms. Pierce whole upon certain qualifying terminations of employment that may occur prior to February 16, 2017, because upon any termination of employment prior to February 16, 2017, Ms. Pierce would have forfeited her retention RSU award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 16, 2017, Ms. Pierce is no longer eligible to receive the Contingent Cash Retention Award and her retention RSU award would vest in full upon a termination of her employment by Huntington without cause or her death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, pursuant to the merger agreement between Huntington and FirstMerit Corporation, upon the completion of Huntingtons acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation, FirstMerit determined the amount of fiscal year 2016 bonus payable to Ms. Pierce under its incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Steinours Employment Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Steinours employment agreement provides for certain payments upon a termination of his employment without cause or for good reason (each as defined in the agreement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential payments under these agreements are described and quantified below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination without cause or for good reason, Mr. Steinour is entitled to payment of the following amounts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accrued amounts consisting of unpaid base salary through termination, earned but unpaid annual incentive payments for the prior period, accrued and unused paid time off and incurred but unreimbursed business expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a pro-rata incentive payment in respect of the fiscal year of the company in which the date of termination occurs, with such amount to equal the amount determined by the Compensation Committee based on the Companys actual performance for the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurs and otherwise on a basis no less favorable than annual incentive award determinations are made by the Compensation Committee for the companys executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a severance payment equal to two times his annual base salary and the higher of the target incentive payment for the year of termination or the incentive payment paid or payable with respect to the prior fiscal year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Steinour would also be entitled to payment and provision of any other amounts or benefits to which he was otherwise entitled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mr. Steinour had terminated employment with us without cause or for good reason as of December 31, 2016, he would have been entitled to, in addition to accrued amounts and benefits, a pro rata annual incentive payment equal to $2,475,000 and a severance payment equal to $5,500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mr. Steinour had terminated employment as of December 31, 2016, due to death or disability, he or his estate would have been entitled to a pro rata annual incentive payment for the year of termination (based on the companys actual performance for the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurs and otherwise on a basis no less favorable than annual incentive award determinations are made by the Compensation Committee for the companys executive officers) equal to $2,475,000 and accrued obligations and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mr. Steinour had terminated employment as of December 31, 2016 without good reason and due to his retirement, he would have been entitled to a pro rata annual incentive payment for the year of termination equal to $2,475,000.

sentences.text: Mr. Steinour was not eligible for normal retirement benefits as of December 31, 2016.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors proposes the election of fifteen directors at this annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors elected at the meeting will each serve a one-year term expiring at our 2018 annual meeting when their successors are duly elected and qualify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon consultation with the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, the board of directors has nominated for election or reelection 15 of the 16 directors currently serving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ann B. Crane, Steven G. Elliott, Michael J. Endres, Peter J. Kight, Jonathan A. Levy, Eddie R. Munson, Richard W. Neu, David L. Porteous, Kathleen H. Ransier, and Stephen D. Steinour were each elected at the 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chris Inglis was appointed to the board of directors on May 5, 2016, and Lizabeth Ardisana, Robert S. Cubbin, Gina D. France and J. Michael Hochschwender were appointed to the board of directors effective August 16, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John B. Gerlach, Jr., who joined the board in 1999, is stepping down.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise directed, the shares represented by a properly submitted proxy will be voted FOR the election of each nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2  Ratification of the Appointment of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee regularly evaluates the qualifications, performance, and independence of the independent registered public accounting firm, and whether the independent registered public accounting firm should be rotated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to serve as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP has served as our independent accountant since 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the board of directors believe that the continued retention of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to serve as our independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the company and its investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although not required, we are asking shareholders to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for 2017 because we value our shareholders views on the companys independent registered public accounting firm and as a matter of good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee will reconsider the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP if its selection is not ratified by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP regularly attend meetings of the Audit Committee and will be present at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These representatives will have an opportunity at the annual meeting to make a statement f they desire to do so and also will be available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Audit fees are fees for professional services rendered for the integrated audits of our annual consolidated financial statements, including the audit of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting, quarterly reviews of the condensed consolidated financial statements included in Form 10-Q filings, and services that are normally provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP in connection with statutory/subsidiary financial statement audits, attestation reports required by statute or regulation, and comfort letters and consents related to SEC filings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Audit-related fees generally include fees for assurance and related services that are traditionally performed by the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services include attestation and agreed-upon procedures which address accounting, reporting and control matters that are not required by statute or regulation, pension plans and service organization control examinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services are normally provided in connection with the recurring audit engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) The tax-related services were all in the nature of tax compliance or consultation and advice on business tax matters related to the acquisition of FirstMerit Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) All other fees were generally for advisory services rendered in support of certain operational assessments of our broker-dealer subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for the audit fee negotiations associated with the retention of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has a policy that it will pre-approve all audit and non-audit services provided by the independent accountant, and will not engage the independent accountant to perform any specific non-audit services prohibited by law or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has given general pre-approval for specified audit, audit-related and tax services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of any general pre-approval is 12 months from the date of pre-approval, unless
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Audit Committee specifically provides for a different term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee will annually review the services for which general pre-approval is given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee may revise the list of general pre-approved services from time to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: time, based upon subsequent determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless a type of service to be provided by the independent accountant has received general pre-approval, it will require specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-approval fee levels for all services to be provided by the independent accountant are established annually by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposed services exceeding these levels will require specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee may delegate pre-approval authority to a member of its committee, and has currently delegated pre-approval authority to its chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decisions of the chairman or other member to whom pre-approval authority is delegated must be presented to the full Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the services covered by the fees disclosed above were pre-approved by the Audit Committee or its chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee does not delegate its responsibilities to pre-approve services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has considered and determined that the services described above are compatible with maintaining the independent accountants independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors recommends a vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3  Advisory Approval of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement, our compensation philosophy is to pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our program places heavy emphasis on performance-based compensation, particularly in the form of long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continually strengthen our compensation practices based on our philosophy, market best practices and feedback received from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation policies, practices and decisions for executive officers are described in detail under Compensation of Executive Officers above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation policies and procedures strongly align the interests of executives and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage our executives to focus on long-term performance with long-term incentives and also stock ownership and retention requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We further believe that our culture focuses executives on sound risk management and appropriately rewards executives for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resolution set forth below gives the shareholders the opportunity to vote on the compensation of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of this resolution is required pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the board of directors, we ask shareholders to consider adoption of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the compensation paid to the named executive officers of Huntington Bancshares Incorporated as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including in the Summary Compensation Table, the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the additional compensation tables and the accompanying narrative disclosure, is hereby approved on an advisory, non-binding basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this is an advisory vote, it will not bind the board of directors, however, the Compensation Committee will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors recommends a vote FOR the adoption of the resolution regarding executive compensation, a set forth above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4  Advisory Recommendation on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this annual meeting, shareholders will have the opportunity to consider the frequency of future shareholder advisory votes on executive compensation, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may vote on a non-binding, advisory basis, to recommend that the shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation occur every 1, 2 or 3 calendar years, or may abstain from voting on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal regarding the frequency of shareholder advisory votes on executive compensation is also advisory and will not bind the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote is required pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders last considered the frequency of future shareholder advisory votes on executive compensation in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following that vote, the board of directors determined that it would include a non-binding advisory vote on executive compensation in its proxy materials pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 on an annual basis until the next vote on the frequency of such advisory votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors recommends that shareholders vote to recommend that the shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation occur EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our executive officers is listed below, along with a statement of his or her business experience during at least the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are elected annually by the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STEPHEN D. STEINOUR, age 58, has served as our chairman, president and chief executive officer and as chairman, president and chief executive officer of The Huntington National Bank since January 14, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional detail about Mr. Steinours business experience is set forth under Election of Directors above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RICHARD A. CHEAP, age 65, has served as our general counsel and secretary and as executive vice president, general counsel, secretary and cashier of The Huntington National Bank since May 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cheap also served as a vice president and a director of Huntington Preferred Capital, Inc. from April 2001 to May 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PAUL G. HELLER, age 53, joined the company as chief technology and operations officer and senior executive vice president in October 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since January 2014, Mr. Heller also oversees home lending (including mortgage lending, consumer lending, and mortgage and consumer servicing) and the Phone Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously Mr. Heller was senior vice president and corporate internet group executive for JPMorgan Chase, from December 1999 to October 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HELGA S. HOUSTON, age 55, has served as our chief risk officer since January 2012 and as senior executive vice president since October 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She served as corporate risk managing director from September 2011 through December 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Huntington, Ms. Houston was a partner in Phoenix Global Advisors, LLC, in Charlotte, N.C., from June 2009 to September 2011, where she provided strategic advice to a variety of enterprises on areas ranging from revenue enhancement, enterprise risk management and operational efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Houston was with Bank of America from 1986 to 2008, serving in a variety of capacities, including risk executive for global consumer and small business banking and risk executive for global wealth and investment management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOWELL D. McCULLOUGH III, age 59, joined Huntington as chief financial officer and senior executive vice president in April 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCullough previously served as executive vice president and chief strategy officer of U.S. Bancorp and head of U.S. Bancorps enterprise revenue office from September 2007 to April 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARY W. NAVARRO, age 61, has served as senior executive vice president of The Huntington National Bank since February 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has managed the retail banking business since June 2002 when she joined the Bank as executive vice president.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Her current role includes leadership of the branch network, business banking, marketing, customer advocacy, call centers, deposits and cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DANIEL J. NEUMEYER, age 57, has served as senior executive vice president and chief credit officer for The Huntington National Bank since October 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his current role, Mr. Neumeyer oversees credit policy and risk management, commercial credit transactions, special assets, and collections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Neumeyer was chief credit officer for Comerica Bank, from January 2008 to October 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SANDRA E. PIERCE, age 58, has served as senior executive vice president, private client group & regional banking director, and chair of Michigan, since August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously Ms. Pierce served as Vice Chairman of FirstMerit and Chairman of FirstMerit, Michigan from February 2013 to August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior thereto, Ms. Pierce was president and chief executive officer of Charter One Bank Michigan, from 2004 through June 30, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RICHARD REMIKER, age 59, has served as senior executive vice president and director of commercial banking for The Huntington National Bank since January 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From May 2012 to December 2013, Mr. Remiker served as executive vice president and manager of specialty banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Remiker joined Huntington in May 2010 as President of Huntington Equipment Finance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Huntington, Mr. Remiker was the Chief Administrative Officer for RBS Citizens Asset Finance where his responsibilities included legal, finance, syndication, asset management, technology, operations and portfolio management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NICHOLAS G. STANUTZ, age 62, has served as senior executive vice president since February 2005 and as the director for auto finance and dealer services since June 1999 for The Huntington National Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stanutz also has responsibility for commercial real estate and community development lending and investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RAJEEV SYAL, age 51, has served as senior executive vice president and chief human resources officer since October 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Huntington, Mr. Syal served as managing director and global head of human resources for the Markit Group Ltd., a global financial information services firm, from 2008 to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Syal was senior vice president for human resources at Bank of America Securities, from 2006 to 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARK E. THOMPSON, age 58, has served as senior executive vice president since joining our company in April 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompsons current role is director of corporate operations, which includes oversight of bank integrations,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: corporate real estate and facilities, corporate sourcing, security, fraud risk, and commercial and consumer operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From April 2009 to November 2010, he served as director of strategy and business segment performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously Mr. Thompson served as executive vice president and deputy CFO of ABN AMRO, from October 2007 to April 2009.
